page.title: 18BUILDINGS CHANGE,COLD ASHTON
page.content: Just as places names gives clues to ownership or surroundings, so the names of houses can give a picture of the changes in village life over the centuries. The{Old Rectories}at Doynton and Cold Ashton are now houses because the incumbent no longer lives in the villages with the trend to amalgamate livings. Rectory Farm, Doynton is also a private house with the land sold off and worked by a neighbouring farm. The {Old Brewery}is no longer economic and is now private housing.Monkswood House is now owned by the{water board}and is no longer a farm, to avoid poluting the reservoir.A{papermill}near there is being converted to a cottage. The old{school}and the old{pub}in Cold Ashton have both been converted to private houses,The latter being the only thatched building in the area.
